I love sushi!! and I love all your can eat sushi for $20!! The sushi chefs here are always awesome... my boyfriend and I go and CHOW DOWN.  They have some awesome rolls, and always get them out quickly. 

Hon Machi is teppan, sushi and I believe they have regular menu items like teriyaki chicken.  I can only review the sushi bar because that is all I have ever gone for. I give 4 stars because it seems like they have a high turnover on wait staff, and they always seem to be training.  After one roll they tried to take my ginger and wasabi! ha! no worries though! 

So many options of rolls for the all you can eat (I wish squid salad was part of it!) I really like the tootsy roll, Arizona roll, and shrimp tempura. My boyfriend loves that nigiri is part of the all you can eat which isnt part of the happy hour. 

I love this place, we go every couple of weeks.  All you can eat is Sunday-Wednesday.  I would love to try the teppan there once because people seem to enjoy it!

I just recently moved to the area and decided to do a little research on nearby sushi restaurants. Hon Machi is right down the street from where I live so I decided to look at their online menu. On their website it specifically states that Happy Hour is from 3 pm-6 pm. However, after dining at the restaurant I was charged full price. I brought this to the attention of the hostess and she just said that the website is wrong and their Happy Hour is from 5 pm-6 pm. Why wasn't this communicated to me before when I ordered off of the Happy Hour menu that she gave me? It's too bad because the food was good and the guys making the sushi were excellent. I almost feel like I was purposely deceived just so I would have to pay full price. So my intentions of paying a little over $10 for a meal turned into a $20 meal. Not a great way to impress first time guests. Unfortunately I will not be returning.

First...buying sushi in the desert is a sketchy proposition at best.

With that said we ordered sushi platter and some sort of teriyaki steak.

Steak was actually pretty good

Sushi was serviceable, but nothing special

Overall not bad.

We had lunch here on Sunday...total drive-by. WOW! Originally we set out to visit Yogi Teriyaki - and they're closed on Sunday?!! We had the Bento Combos 1 & 2 and the green tea. The Miso soup was tasty, and the house salad has a delicious dressing. Teriyaki Chicken was tender and full of flavor, the tempura was hot and crunchy (I like), sashimi was ok, the sushi was yum, even though it was only California roll. The Bento Combos were really quite artful, wish I'd taken a photo. I'm going back soon to really try the sushi - they've got quite a selection. This place gets points for Japanese atmosphere, and also the impossibly attractive hostess and server, who were both very knowledgeable of all the items on the menu - regular James Bond-style Supervixens! Dig the menu item pics, the prices are not unreasonable, and if you like Teppanyaki they have big table seating around the grills, as well as booths, regular tables, and sushi bar seating.

Was there for a late lunch the other day around 1pm in order to check the place and use my Groupon (again, I know).  

I was pretty much the only one in the restaurant so I got quick service and full attention. 

The waiter, Andrew, recommended the New Orleans roll as one of his preferred roll. I decided to order 3 hand rolls (Spicy salmon, scallops and yellow tail) on top of the New Orleans. 

I got the hand rolls first and they were big and delicious but I thought that for $6 a piece they had to as I usually pay $3.50 or so for the same elsewhere. Then the New Orleans came. It made me thinking that I did the right choice ordering hand rolls rather than rolls but it could be me and my likings too. This one felt pretty blend comparing to what I got before and the tuna on top was a bit tasteless. 

I like when all the flavors create some kind of a firework in your mount but this one was far from it. At least it was crunchy, so I got the noise from the firework without the show, a bit disappointed there. In my mind I could have used another hand roll, oh well.

I ended up paying $2 plus tip which wasn't bad when you consider the Groupon ($30). I guess I will give it another shot next time I can grab another discount but for now I'm still chewing on this last toll.
